data.enText: an amount of money that is given to sb regularly or for a particular purpose
an allowance of $20 a day

data.chText: 服装 / 生活 / 交通补贴
data.enText: a clothing/living/travel allowance
Do you get an allowance for clothing?
the amount of sth that is allowed in a particular situation
a baggage allowance of 20 kilos
an amount of money that can be earned or received before you start paying tax
personal tax allowances
make allowance(s) for sth

data.chText: 考虑到，估计到（如在决策或计划时）
data.enText: to consider sth, for example when you are making a decision or planning sth

data.chText: 预算考虑到了通货膨胀。
data.enText: The budget made allowance for inflation.

data.chText: 这个计划没有把人们工作速度不同考虑在内。
data.enText: The plan makes no allowance for people working at different rates.
make allowances (for sb)
to allow sb to behave in a way that you would not usually accept, because of a problem or because there is a special reason

ex.chText: 只剩两笔交易的佣金未付。
ex.enText: There are only two items of commission left unpaid.

ex.chText: 他从销售的货物中提取5%的佣金。
ex.enText: He took 5% commission on the goods he had sold.

synonyms.bx: 通常指按销售额付给销售人员的提成。

ex.enText: Do the workers get an allowance for clothing?

synonyms.bx: 指定期或出于特殊原因而给予的补贴费用。

ex.chText: 员工们期待着在圣诞节得到一大笔奖金。
ex.enText: The staff is expecting a large Christmas bonus.

ex.chText: 他决定在领到奖金后辞职。
ex.enText: He decided to quit his job after getting the bonus.

synonyms.bx: 尤指企业为奖励表现出色的员工而发放的奖金。

ex.chText: 我认为那个律师收费很高。
ex.enText: I thought the lawyer's fee was rather high.

ex.chText: 那家健身俱乐部收取会员年费。
ex.enText: That health club charges an annual membership fee.

ex.chText: 在这家银行开立账户要收费。
ex.enText: The bank charges a fee for setting up an account.

synonyms.bx: 指付给专业人士的劳务费，也指学费、会费、手续费等。

ex.chText: 他积极努力，应得到奖赏。
ex.enText: He deserves a reward for his efforts.

ex.chText: 这份工作很辛苦，但报酬丰厚。
ex.enText: This job is really hard, but the financial rewards are great.
The police have offered a reward of $10,000.

synonyms.bx: 指给予勤劳及品德高尚者的奖励，也指警方提供的悬赏金，常后接介词 for/of。

data.enText: make allowance(s) for sth

data.chText: 考虑到，估计到（如在决策或计划时）
data.enText: to consider sth, for example when you are making a decision or planning sth

data.chText: 预算考虑到了通货膨胀。
data.enText: The budget made allowance for inflation.

data.chText: 这个计划没有把人们工作速度不同考虑在内。
data.enText: The plan makes no allowance for people working at different rates.
make allowances (for sb)
to allow sb to behave in a way that you would not usually accept, because of a problem or because there is a special reason

example: He objected to the allowance of smoking in the dining room

tr: allowing some freedom to move within limits
an amount added or deducted on the basis of qualifying circumstances
an amount allowed or granted (as during a given period)
example: my weekly allowance of two eggs
a child's allowance should not be too generous

tr: a sum granted as reimbursement for expenses
a reserve fund created by a charge against profits in order to provide for changes in the value of a company's assets
put on a fixed allowance, as of food

value.def: An allowance is money that is given to someone, usually on a regular basis, in order to help them pay for the things that they need.

example.ex: He lives on a single parent's allowance of £70 a week...
example.tran: 他靠每周70英镑的单亲家庭生活补助过日子。

example.ex: She gets an allowance for looking after Lillian.
example.tran: 她因为照顾莉莲而拿补贴。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> amount

value.def: A child's allowance is money that is given to him or her every week or every month by his or her parents.

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, use 英国英语用 pocket money

value.def: Your tax allowance is the amount of money that you are allowed to earn before you have to start paying income tax.

example.ex: ...those earning less than the basic tax allowance.
example.tran: 那些收入低于基本免税额的人

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 personal exemption

value.def: A particular type of allowance is an amount of something that you are allowed in particular circumstances.

example.ex: Most of our flights have a baggage allowance of 44lbs per passenger.
example.tran: 我们大多数航班行李限重为每位乘客44磅。

value.def: If you make allowances for something, you take it into account in your decisions, plans, or actions.

example.ex: We'll make allowances in the schedule for time off...
example.tran: 日程安排时我们会把休息时间考虑在内。

example.ex: The raw exam results make no allowance for social background.
example.tran: 原始的考试成绩是不受社会背景影响的。

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, oft PHR <l>for</l> n

value.tran: 考虑到；将…计算在内；为…酌留余地

value.def: If you make allowances for someone, you accept behaviour which you would not normally accept or deal with them less severely than you would normally, because of a problem that they have.

example.ex: He's tired so I'll make allowances for him.
example.tran: 他很累，所以我会体谅他。

trans: 免费行李配额，免费行李重量限额
